[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Gamma-J Web Store defines e-commerce requirements for browsing, purchasing, and accounts.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Gamma-J enables customer purchases and allows administrators to manage inventory, orders, and accounts.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Gamma-J integrates with payment gateways and shipping providers for transactions and fulfillment.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Gamma-J provides a responsive web interface for customers and admins.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Gamma-J operates on cloud infrastructure for scalability.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Gamma-J supports REST APIs for payments and shipping.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Gamma-J secures data with HTTPS and TLS 1.3.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Gamma-J optimizes memory use for efficiency.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Gamma-J ensures 24/7 availability with automated monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Gamma-J scales dynamically for high-traffic events.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Gamma-J integrates with analytics tools for tracking and reporting.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Gamma-J handles browsing, purchases, tracking, and inventory.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Users include customers, administrators, and customer support staff.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Gamma-J depends on payment processors and internetconnectivity.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Gamma-J requires third-party services for payments, shipping, and analytics.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Order Fulfillment: Process of completing an order from payment to delivery.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with payment gateways for secure transactions.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support shipping service integration for real-time tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow customers to create and manage accounts.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall process payments via integrated gateways (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall track orders and provide status updates (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall support a responsive design for device compatibility.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall provide an intuitive navigation experience.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall support up to many thousands concurrent users.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall process transactions without significant delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store product, order, and user data securely.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support real-time inventory updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall be optimized for cloud deployment.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with PCI DSS for secure payments.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall meet GDPR data protection standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically to handle traffic spikes.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log critical transactions for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Usability tests, performance benchmarks, and compliance validation.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Integration guides, API documentation, and user manuals.
